{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3220855,"name":"Adam Pullen","username":"Adam_6877","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adam_6877/{size}/196524_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-24T21:46:16.545Z","cooked":"

Hello,

Where should I connect the 5 pins into the Roborio from the AMT103-V encoders? I think that I should connect 3 of each encoder pins into the DIO port. Do 5V and G go someplace else?

Was searching online and couldn‚Äôt find a direct answer. Thanks in advance for your help!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-07-24T21:46:16.545Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":46,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":254.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":439188,"topic_slug":"amt103-v-encoder-to-roborio","display_username":"Adam Pullen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54344,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/amt103-v-encoder-to-roborio/439188/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3220858,"name":"bobbysq","username":"bobbysq","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bobbysq/{size}/195893_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-24T22:00:41.637Z","cooked":"

A and B should go to DIO signal pins. X is optional, as it‚Äôs an ‚Äúindex‚Äù pin which ticks whenever the encoder makes a full revolution. 5V and G go to 5 volts and ground, which are supplied by the roboRIO.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-07-24T22:00:41.637Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":120,"readers_count":119,"score":64.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":439188,"topic_slug":"amt103-v-encoder-to-roborio","display_username":"bobbysq","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28014,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"he/him"},"post_url":"/t/amt103-v-encoder-to-roborio/439188/2","custom_user_title":"he/him","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3220896,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-25T02:01:20.038Z","cooked":"
bobbysq:

X is optional, as it‚Äôs an ‚Äúindex‚Äù pin which ticks whenever the encoder makes a full revolution

Out of my own curiosity, is there any viable way to use this pin in a sensible way? For example using a simple Counter within code and counting the ticks on that pin?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-07-25T02:01:20.038Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":103,"readers_count":102,"score":40.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":439188,"topic_slug":"amt103-v-encoder-to-roborio","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/amt103-v-encoder-to-roborio/439188/3","custom_user_title":"6032 | QDash","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3220973,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-25T15:11:32.462Z","cooked":"

Yes, the Encoder class has integrated support for an index channel, which will reset the encoder value when it is triggered. See Encoder (WPILib API 2023.4.3)

You can alternatively hook up a Counter to it if you want 1 PPR for some other reason.

Sample point:

Way back in the day we did a swerve drive that used the functionality to get absolute angle of each module.

When the robot first enabled we had to run a ‚Äúcalibration‚Äù routine to spin the modules open loop until we saw a pulse on the pin and could ‚Äúreset‚Äù to the known position.

While possible, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this for new designs. There‚Äôs plenty of high-quality absolute encoders available.
